page.title: 03Walk round Moy
page.content: We took a trip from school to Moy to have a look round. The rhodedendrons were in bud. We noted the date on Jock O Moys house 1906 and walked on to Garden Cottage. A friend was out walking her dogs. We stopped to look at Gaelic writing on a stone and walked up the Farm Road to the Farm House. On our way round the village we saw a joiner/metal worker who comes from Inverness to work in the steading. We rang the old fire bell. The cat emblem on a classmate's house matched that on the farm steading. CAT EMBLEM on steading 1884 and on a Forestry house _ TOUCH NOT THE CAT BOT A GLOVE. FIREBELL _ MACKINTOSH CHIEF OF CLAN CHATTAN _ not now used. COMMEMORATIVE STONE _ FAICH NAN EACH CLASA NAN RIGH 29 JULY 1934.
